intro: Lomaria melanocaulon, commonly known as the black-stemmed lomaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its slender, upright stems that turn dark purple or black with age. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Lomaria melanocaulon is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cool, dry climates.
